item.title: Moral Law vs Ceremonial law
item.description:
List from total onslaught - an advocate for our time. The two major division of the law.

Moral precepts Ceremonial Law
[James]
2:8-12

"The Royal Law"
"The Law of Liberty"

 "Laws of command" Eph 2:15
Exo 31:18
32:16		 Written with the
Finger of God on stone		 "Written by Moses in the book of the Law" Deu 31:9-24
Deu 10:1-5
1Ki 8:9		 Placed inside
the ark		 Placed beside the ark Deu 31:24-26
Rom 3:20
Rom 7:7		 Purpose to reveal
sin		 Given after sin Gal 3:19
Deu 5:22
Ps 19:7
Rom 7:12		 "Complete, Perfect
Holy, Just, Good"		 Purpose - to reveal
the remedy for sin		 Lev 6:1 Lev 6:7
Joh 7:29
Psa 111:7-8 Stand for ever Temporary Mat 27:51

 Are these actually whats fullfilled by God-with-us. Or was not the ceremonial laws made spiritual law?
If we consider sayings of the Lord, he states several times with variations as like this "what is washing hands, or having a outer clean, when the inside is dirty".
What is the church now?. Or even the very act of making a blood, or burnt offer to God.
I wouldn"t say that any laws were done away with. Even the ceremonial laws that were to show his coming.
With baptizm, is it merely spring water that clense us, or is not the word the Holy Spirit, or the words of the Lord?
Before him, did they not baptize with water?

Notes regarding some books of the bible:

Gen
Exo
Lev
Num
Deu

Mat
Mar
Luk
Joh

Book of origins, the fall and promise of redemption.
Christ our sanctuary
Christ our sacrifice
Christ our guide
Christ our reward

Christ the king
Christ the servant
Christ the man
Christ the divine

Laws in the new testament:

1. Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve
Mat 4:10 Rev 18:10		 5. Honour thy father and thy mother.
Mat 19:19 Eph 6:1-3
2. Little children, keep yourselves from idols.
1jo 5:21 Act 17:29		 6. Thou shalt not kill.
Rom 13:9 Jam 2:11
3. that the name of God and his doctrine be not blasphemed.
1ti 6:1		 7. Thou shalt not commit adultery.
Mat 19:18
4. The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath: Therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.
Mar 2:27-28 Heb 4:4

 8. Thou shalt not steal.
Rom 13:8 Eph 4:20
9. Thou shalt not bear false witness.
Rom 13:9
10. Thou shalt not covet.
Rom 7:7
